basic_input_options.title: Basic Input Options
basic_input_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data.

fastq.description: A fastq file or directory containing fastq input files or directories of input files.
fastq.help_text: If directories named \"barcode*\" are found under the `--fastq` directory the data is assumed to be multiplex and each barcode directory will be processed independently.

output_options.title: Basic Output Options
output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find output data.

emu_output_dir.description: output directory name for emu abundances

output_basename.description: basename for all emu output files.

keep_counts.description: include estimated read counts in output.

keep_files.description: keep working files (.sam alignment file) in output-dir.

keep_read_assignments.description: output file of read assignment distribution.

output_unclassified.description: output unclassified sequences in a separate file.

reference_options.title: Reference Options
reference_options.description: Files will be downloaded as part of the first run of workflow and automatically stored for subsequent runs.

database.description: Sets the reference database used for classifying reads. Choices: ['emu_default', 'rdp', 'silva', 'unite_fungi', 'unite_all']
database.help_text: This setting is overridable by providing an explicit database in the other reference options

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

num_alignments.description: minimap max number of secondary alignments per read.

process_label.description: The main process label for template processes to use by default

docs.intro:
## Introduction

This section of documentation typically contains an overview of the workflow in terms of motivation
and bioinformatics methods, listing any key tools or algorithms employed, whilst also describing its
range of use-cases and what a suitable input dataset should look like.
